articles.title: China's Shanghai Symphony Orchestra gives performance in Pyongyang
Struggle against outsiders' anti-reunification offensive called for
articles.content:
China's Shanghai Symphony Orchestra gives performance in Pyongyang 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The visiting Shanghai Symphony Orchestra of china gave a performance at the April 25 House of Culture in Pyongyang yesterday.
 The artistes of the orchestra put on the stage colorful numbers including orchestras, violin concerts and Korean songs.
 The performance was appreciated by diplomatic envoys and embassy officials of different countries to the DPRK, representatives of international organizations, foreign guests staying in Korea, and ambassador Wang Guozhang and officials of the Chinese embassy.   
 It was also enjoyed by vice-minister of culture Song Sok Hwan, officials concerned and citizens.

articles.title: Foundation anniversary of KNPC marked
Appeal for holding "grand meeting to congratulate sun of 21st century" supported
articles.content:
Foundation anniversary of KNPC marked 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held here on March 24 under the sponsorship of the Korean National Peace Committee to mark the 52nd anniversary of its foundation.
 Ri Song Ho, vice-chairman of the committee, made a congratulatory address which was followed by speeches.

articles.title: Japan's moves to evade settlement of past under fire
articles.content:
Appeal for holding "grand meeting to congratulate sun of 21st century" supported 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Different countries have rendered support to an appeal adopted at an extraordinary meeting of the Latin American and Caribbean Regional Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, which called for holding a "grand meeting to congratulate the sun of the 21st century" in the area of the secret camp on Mt. Paektu in northern part of Korea where leader Kim Jong Il's native home is located, to mark February 16, his birthday, next year.
 Predrag Churchich, chairman of the Yugoslavia-Korea Friendship Association, in a statement said that it is quite natural in view of Kim Jong Il's great feats and his absolute position in the international communist movement and labour movement to hold the "grand meeting to congratulate the sun of the 21st century" in the area of the secret camp on Mt. Paektu.    
 Georgi Stoyanov, chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, in his statement said that the world progressives boundlessly revere Kim Jong Il who is wisely leading the party, state and army of the DPRK, and expressed support to the appeal which called for holding the grand meeting.
